summary.long: Habakkuk is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The revelation which Habakkuk the prophet saw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh, how long will I cry, and you will not hear? I cry out to you “Violence!” and will you not save?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you show me iniquity, and look at perversity? For destruction and violence are before me. There is strife, and contention rises up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the law is paralyzed, and justice never prevails; for the wicked surround the righteous; therefore justice comes out perverted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look among the nations, watch, and wonder marvelously; for I am working a work in your days which you will not believe though it is told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, behold, I am raising up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation who march through the width of the earth, to possess dwelling places that are not theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are feared and dreaded. Their judgment and their dignity proceed from themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their horses also are swifter than leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves. Their horsemen press proudly on. Yes, their horsemen come from afar. They fly as an eagle that hurries to devour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them come for violence. Their hordes face forward. They gather prisoners like sand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, they scoff at kings, and princes are a derision to them. They laugh at every stronghold, for they build up an earthen ramp and take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they sweep by like the wind and go on. They are indeed guilty, whose strength is their god.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aren’t you from everlasting, Yahweh my God, my Holy One? We will not die. Yahweh, you have appointed them for judgment. You, Rock, have established him to punish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You who have purer eyes than to see evil, and who cannot look on perversity, why do you tolerate those who deal treacherously and keep silent when the wicked swallows up the man who is more righteous than he,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and make men like the fish of the sea, like the creeping things that have no ruler over them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He takes up all of them with the hook. He catches them in his net and gathers them in his dragnet. Therefore he rejoices and is glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he sacrifices to his net and burns incense to his dragnet, because by them his life is luxurious and his food is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will he therefore continually empty his net, and kill the nations without mercy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will stand at my watch and set myself on the ramparts, and will look out to see what he will say to me, and what I will answer concerning my complaint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh answered me, “Write the vision, and make it plain on tablets, that he who runs may read it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the vision is yet for the appointed time, and it hurries toward the end, and won’t prove false. Though it takes time, wait for it, because it will surely come. It won’t delay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, his soul is puffed up. It is not upright in him, but the righteous will live by his faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, moreover, wine is treacherous: an arrogant man who doesn’t stay at home, who enlarges his desire as Sheol; he is like death and can’t be satisfied, but gathers to himself all nations and heaps to himself all peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Won’t all these take up a parable against him, and a taunting proverb against him, and say, ‘Woe to him who increases that which is not his, and who enriches himself by extortion! How long?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Won’t your debtors rise up suddenly, and wake up those who make you tremble, and you will be their victim?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because you have plundered many nations, all the remnant of the peoples will plunder you because of men’s blood, and for the violence done to the land, to the city and to all who dwell in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to him who gets an evil gain for his house, that he may set his nest on high, that he may be delivered from the hand of evil!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have devised shame to your house by cutting off many peoples, and have sinned against your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the stone will cry out of the wall, and the beam out of the woodwork will answer it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to him who builds a town with blood, and establishes a city by iniquity!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, isn’t it from Yahweh of Armies that the peoples labor for the fire, and the nations weary themselves for vanity?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of Yahweh’s glory, as the waters cover the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to him who gives his neighbor drink, pouring your inflaming wine until they are drunk, so that you may gaze at their naked bodies!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are filled with shame, and not glory. You will also drink and be exposed! The cup of Yahweh’s right hand will come around to you, and disgrace will cover your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the violence done to Lebanon will overwhelm you, and the destruction of the animals will terrify you, because of men’s blood and for the violence done to the land, to every city and to those who dwell in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What value does the engraved image have, that its maker has engraved it; the molten image, even the teacher of lies, that he who fashions its form trusts in it, to make mute idols?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to him who says to the wood, ‘Awake!’ or to the mute stone, ‘Arise!’ Shall this teach? Behold, it is overlaid with gold and silver, and there is no breath at all within it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Yahweh is in his holy temple. Let all the earth be silent before him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A prayer of Habakkuk, the prophet, set to victorious music.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh, I have heard of your fame.
    I stand in awe of your deeds, Yahweh.
Renew your work in the middle of the years.
    In the middle of the years make it known.
    In wrath, you remember mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God came from Teman,
    the Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah. 
His glory covered the heavens,
    and his praise filled the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His splendor is like the sunrise.
    Rays shine from his hand, where his power is hidden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Plague went before him,
    and pestilence followed his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stood, and shook the earth.
    He looked, and made the nations tremble.
    The ancient mountains were crumbled.
    The age-old hills collapsed.
    His ways are eternal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction.
    The dwellings of the land of Midian trembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Was Yahweh displeased with the rivers?
    Was your anger against the rivers,
    or your wrath against the sea,
    that you rode on your horses,
    on your chariots of salvation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You uncovered your bow.
    You called for your sworn arrows. Selah.
You split the earth with rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains saw you, and were afraid.
    The storm of waters passed by.
    The deep roared and lifted up its hands on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun and moon stood still in the sky
    at the light of your arrows as they went,
    at the shining of your glittering spear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You marched through the land in wrath.
    You threshed the nations in anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You went out for the salvation of your people,
    for the salvation of your anointed.
You crushed the head of the land of wickedness.
    You stripped them head to foot. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You pierced the heads of his warriors with their own spears.
    They came as a whirlwind to scatter me,
    gloating as if to devour the wretched in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You trampled the sea with your horses,
    churning mighty waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I heard, and my body trembled.
    My lips quivered at the voice.
Rottenness enters into my bones, and I tremble in my place
    because I must wait quietly for the day of trouble,
    for the coming up of the people who invade us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For even though the fig tree doesn’t flourish,
    nor fruit be in the vines,
    the labor of the olive fails,
    the fields yield no food,
    the flocks are cut off from the fold,
    and there is no herd in the stalls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
yet I will rejoice in Yahweh.
    I will be joyful in the God of my salvation!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh, the Lord, is my strength.
    He makes my feet like deer’s feet,
    and enables me to go in high places.
For the music director, on my stringed instruments.
verses.speaker: Narrator
